-ThresholdInterval.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckIISAppPoolHealth_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-OverrideNoWorker.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckIISAppPoolHealth_String_OverrideNoWorker$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-C.value: try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output 'Error:' $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable 'icinga-powershell-*' )`r`n'Module-Path:'`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath); exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command '$ifw_api_command$'

16.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
16.caption: Verbosity

7.description:
The memory usage that triggers a warning state. Supports the % to compare the current
memory usage against a configured limit of the AppPool.
7.caption: MemoryWarning

5.description: The CPU usage percentage that triggers a warning state.
5.caption: CPUWarning

12.description: The page file usage that triggers a critical state for the AppPools
12.caption: PageFileCritical

10.description: The thread count that triggers a critical state for the AppPools
10.caption: ThreadCountCritical

2.description: Defines with which Execution Policy the PowerShell is started
2.caption: PowerShell Execution Policy

8.description:
The memory usage that triggers a critical state. Supports the % to compare the current
memory usage against a configured limit of the AppPool.
8.caption: MemoryCritical

17.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin
17.caption: NoPerfData

11.description: The page file usage that triggers a warning state for the AppPools
11.caption: PageFileWarning

9.description: The thread count that triggers a warning state for the AppPools
9.caption: ThreadCountWarning

14.description: An array of application pool names to exclude from the check.
14.caption: ExcludeAppPools

15.description: The state to set if no worker process is found for an application pool. Valid values are 'Ok', 'Warning', 'Critical', 'Unknown'. Default is 'Critical'.
15.caption: OverrideNoWorker

6.description: The CPU usage percentage that triggers a critical state.
6.caption: CPUCritical

4.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/service/10-Register-Service-Checks/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
4.caption: ThresholdInterval

13.description: An array of application pool names to include in the check.
13.caption: IncludeAppPools
